content.raw:
Summary:
The standpipe/hose state machine refuses to create a link if the initial link is broken.

Detail:
I've written a little gazebo plugin to automatically attach the hose. It just uses SetWorldPose() to position the coupling:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MRVrvdsRUAs
... this works just fine and vrc_score reports that the standpipe/hose link has been made.

However if I counter-rotate the hose and it comes off, it cannot ever go back on - even with a dozen re-attachements:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wHe-3kmDn9I

To reiterate: my plugin works 100% of time on the first connection and 0% of the time on subsequent connections

I assume that there is a bug in the standpipe/hose state machine.

In addition to fixing this bug, can you please report when it will be fixed on the cloud sim instances?
